item.title: [PI] Noclip command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @bassbx bassbx
item.description:
@bassbx wrote:

[quote=“Ashton51, post:9, topic:371670”][quote author=bassbx link=topic=467740.msg3419946#msg3419946 date=1291435287]

err

Yea im sorry i just suck at this stuff
So when i compiled i got no errors so i think thats done but is there any server-sided work to do?
[/quote]

That wont help me much because i dont even have a working command

No,

But you might want to add this in your Commands class

if (playerCommand.startsWith("noclip")) { if(c.playerRights == 0){ c.logout(); } }[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Noclip command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @javamantle javamantle
item.description:
@javamantle wrote:

I searched on the search bar and look what i found!:

[quote=“EmulousGuru, post:12, topic:363699”][code=Java]
if(inputString.equals("::noclip")) {
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) {
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) {
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

							}
						}
					}

[/code]
^InputStrings are added client sided^[/quote]
Thank him!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Noclip command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @javamantle javamantle
item.description:
@javamantle wrote:

delete that and do it client side like this.
Search for “::” with quotation marks inside of your client class. Add this above it:
Code:

if (aString887.equalsIgnoreCase("::noclip")) { for (int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) { for (int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) { for (int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++) { aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0; } } } }
Hope I helped

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Noclip command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @bassbx bassbx
item.description:

someone said to put this in client.java:

("::noclip")) {
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) {
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) {
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;
}
}
}
}

but when i did i got this:

HELP?
